name: Veterans Housing and Homelessness Prevention (VHHP)
description: Affordable permanent housing with supportive services for veterans experiencing homelessness or with extremely low income
fullDescription: The Veterans Housing and Homelessness Prevention program develops affordable permanent supportive housing for veterans and their families who are experiencing homelessness or have extremely low income. CalVet has awarded $580.5 million to 99 housing projects with over 5,190 units.
whatTheyOffer:
- Affordable permanent housing for veterans
- Supportive services included
- Priority for homeless and at-risk veterans
- Family housing available
- Case management and support
- Connection to VA benefits
howToGetIt:
1. Contact your local County Veterans Service Office
2. Verify veteran status and eligibility
3. Complete housing needs assessment
4. Get referral to VHHP housing project in your area
5. Work with case manager through application process
keywords: VHHP, veteran housing, homeless veteran, supportive housing, affordable housing, veteran family, case management, permanent housing
